name: "The Ranch": Part Five Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: How did Beau react when Colt told him that they could lose Iron River Ranch in "Starting Over Again"?
options: Beau walked out of the house
questions.explanation:
Beau was angry.

	In "Starting Over Again", Colt and Rooster had to tell Beau that they used his power of attorney to buy the Peterson Ranch and now they could lose Iron River Ranch because they didn't get the pipeline money. Beau and Maggie were both angry at the boys.

questions.text: Abby learned that she and Colt were pregnant while working in Denver. What holiday dinner did she yell out the news in "It's All Wrong, But It's All Right"?
questions.explanation:
Easter dinner.

	"It's All Wrong, But It's All Right" found Maggie working Iron River Ranch and then going to work at the bar. Rooster took over some of the duties to help his mom and to make amends for what he and Colt did. While at Easter dinner with the Bennett family and the Phillips family, Abby yelled out that she was pregnant during an argument both sides were having.

questions.text: Did Colt take the job that Abby's father, Chuck, offered him at his John Deere store in "A Gamble Either Way"?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Beau had talked Colt into taking the job with Chuck so his family would be secure. Colt went to the store to accept the job, but changed his mind when he realized that his family was more than Abby and their unborn child. Colt wanted his child to grow up like he and his dad did.

questions.text: Who stood up for Abby and Colt at their courthouse wedding in "Baby, I'm Burning"?
questions.correct: No one. A fire kept them from getting married
questions.explanation:
No one. A fire kept them from getting married

	Abby made the decision to get married at the courthouse and when the baby was born they would have a real wedding. Rooster agreed to stand up for them at the courthouse, but a fire kept them from going to the courthouse to get married.

questions.text: Maggie said all the middle names of the Bennett boys while trying to get them to evacuate the ranch. What was so special about their middle names in "Travelin' Prayer"?
questions.explanation:
Names of former presidents.

	When Maggie went by the ranch to check on everyone, she found Beau, Colt, and Rooster arguing in the living room. Maggie gave all three of them their middle names when talking to them. Colt's middle name is Reagan. Rooster's middle name is Ford. Beau's middle name is Roosevelt.

questions.text: Rooster was introduced to Mary's ex-husband in "Tie Our Love". What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Nick.

	Mary's ex-husband was also her first and third ex-husband. Allegedly, he is Darlene's father. Nick used to be in prison. He threatened to kill Rooster if Rooster went around Mary again.

questions.text: While at the bar with his mom, Rooster hit on a woman that walked in looking for Maggie. What relation did she end up being to him in "Telling Me Lies"?
questions.explanation:
Rooster's aunt.

	Maggie was doing inventory after everyone was allowed to return to their homes and places of business after the fire. Rooster came over to talk with her and get a drink. When Maggie walked to the back, a woman walked into the bar looking for Maggie. Rooster hit on her before Maggie introduced her sister Karen to Rooster. Even knowing who she was, Rooster caught himself continuing to hit on her.

questions.text: Who told Lisa Neumann not to drop the charges against Colt for stealing one of Neumann's Hill generators in "Fresh Out of Forgiveness"?
questions.explanation:
Beau.

	Colt called in the favor Lisa Neumann offered Beau for allowing her cattle to graze on his land until she could get them to market. Rooster was actually the one that stole the generator, but let Colt continue to take the blame. When Beau found out that Colt asked Lisa Neumann to drop the charges, he told Lisa to let the charges stand.

questions.text: Who wanted to sell the Petersen ranch to Neumann's Hill in "It Ain't Fair That It Ain't Right"?
questions.explanation:
Beau.

	Lisa Neumann told Beau she would love to have both the Iron River ranch and the Petersen ranch but Beau only wanted to sell the Petersen ranch. Colt was going to rebuild and raise his daughter with Abby on the ranch.

questions.text: Danny Masterson left "The Ranch" with Rooster leaving Iron River after being threatened by Mary's boyfriend, Nick.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Nick broke into Rooster's cabin for a second time and threatened to kill him. This time when Nick pointed a gun at him, Rooster took his gear and left. Nick told Rooster if he told anyone about the threat, he would kill Rooster's family.
